author: burton
msg: support for onContentItem from within the capture output layer

author: mrdon
msg: Adding ability for browser client to call flow methods within the flow.
This technique uses XMLHTTPRequest or whatever the browser has available
to call javascript functions on the server side using JSON as the transport
back and forth.  The function calls are within the continuation flow meaning
all the global variables will have the correct flow-specific values available
and even modifications will be saved.
The JSON data exchange is validated on the server end to ensure no malicious
code is being sent from the client.  At this point, the JSON serialization is
relatively primitive although it can handle arrays, collections, and JavaBeans.
The new remote-example adds a "cheat" button to the number guess example which
calls the server flow and retrieves the secret number.
